isis.stitle: Recall 02515 - Under-Torqued Brake Spider or Anchor Plate Mounting Bolts On The Right Side of Certain 9100i, 9200i, 9400i and 9900i Models Built Between 7/22/02 and 8/16/02

recall.subject: Under-Torqued Brake Spider or Anchor Plate Mounting Bolts On The Right Side of Certain 9100i, 9200i, 9400i and 9900i Models Built Between 7/22/02 and 8/16/02

para.exhotlnk: Print ready (PDF file) copy of the dealer letter
Print ready (PDF file) copy of the customer letter

defect.para: The bolts securing the brake spider to the front axle wheel end and the rear axle(s) wheel end were under torqued during the vehicle assembly line operation on the right side of the vehicle ONLY. The low torque may not provide the necessary clamp load to adequately secure the brake spider to the axle wheel end.

If the clamp load of the fasteners is not sufficient, the brake spider will move when the brakes are applied in either the forward or reverse direction. Such movement may cause individual brake components to fail or eventually fatigue the brake spider mounting bolts. If all the bolts fail due to fatigue, the result would be complete loss of braking at that wheel end. Any reduced braking power can result in extended stopping distance, which could result in a loss of vehicle control, which in turn could cause an accident, possibly resulting in property damage, personal injury or death.

Certain 9100i, 9200i, 9400i and 9900i models built between 7/22/02 and 8/16/02 are involved in this recall. Only the brake spider fasteners on the right side of the vehicle are to be campaigned. Exceptions: The front axles on vehicles with front axle codes 02ARK or 02ARL are NOT involved because they came to the assembly line with the brake spiders already installed. Only the right rear wheel end(s) on these vehicles will need repair.
Verify vehicles involved using ISIS or use the attached VIN list (contains ALL VIN's in this recall).

ownernote.para: International Truck and Engine Corporation will notify owners of these vehicles about this campaign. During the recall process, a listing of owner names and addresses will be furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners and have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign, because the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

note.para: ONLY AFFECTS RIGHT SIDE OF VEHICLE.

para.emph: Before performing the service, please read and understand the following instructions completely.

svcprocinfo.para: INTRODUCTION: Before starting the procedure, check the front axle code or reference the VIN list at the end of this letter to determine if the front axle needs serviced for this recall. If the front axle code is 02ARK or 02ARL the front axle is not involved and the VIN list will say "None Required". These two axles are the only exceptions. All other axles must have the right side brake spider mounting fasteners re-torqued. Reference the PART INFORMATION section of this letter to determine the parts required.

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.
Block the wheels to prevent the vehicle from moving. If a vehicle moves unexpectedly or suddenly, the result could be serious personal injury or death.

step1.para: Open the hood assembly.

warning.para: Raise the vehicle as necessary. Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or fall over, potentially resulting in serious personal injury or death.

step1.para: Continue to the front axle service procedure if necessary then perform the rear axle service procedure on all vehicles.

svcsubproc.title: Front Axle Service Procedure (If Necessary, Right Side Only)

step1.para: Back off front axle brake shoe adjustment to allow for wheel assembly removal.
Place a container under the hub cap to catch oil and remove hub cap.
Remove outer wheel bearing adjusting nut.
Remove wheel, rim, hub and bearings as an assembly.
Remove front wheel oil seal.
Install new front wheel oil seal.

Remove one brake spider fastener to determine if there is any indication of brake spider chucking (wear marks on the bolts or brake spider caused by movement of the brake spider on the axle); if so, all brake spider mounting fasteners must be replaced (Reference Figure 1). Reference the PART INFORMATION section of this letter for replacement fasteners.
Torque all 7 front brake spider bolts to 175 - 190 Lbf-Ft ( 240 - 260 NM).
Re-install wheel assembly.
Adjust outer wheel bearing adjusting nut; prime wheel cavity with lube; and check end play with dial indicator.
Install wheel hub cap and gasket.
Top off lube in hub cap.
Clean front wheel assembly (wheel and tire) as needed.
Adjust front brake slack adjuster.
Lower front axle assembly and close the hood assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Axle (Right Side Only, but All Rear Axles Need This Service)

step1.para: Remove rear wheel assembly (rim and tire).
Install cage bolt into park brake air chamber.
Loosen rear brake shoe adjustment.
Remove rear brake drum (or hub).

Remove one brake spider fastener to determine if there is any indication of brake spider chucking (wear marks on the bolts or brake spider caused by movement of the brake spider on the axle); if so, all brake spider mounting fasteners must be replaced (Reference Figure 2). Reference the PART INFORMATION section of this letter for replacement fasteners.
Torque ALL (9 or 10) rear brake spider bolts to 175 - 190 Lbf-Ft (240 - 260 NM).
Install rear brake drum (or hub).
Adjust outer wheel bearing adjusting nut and check end play with dial indicator.
Re-install rear wheel assembly (rim and tire).
Adjust rear brake slack adjuster.
Remove cage bolt from park brake air chamber.
Lower rear axle assembly.
Remove wheel chocks.

para.emph: Repeat steps 1 through 13 if the vehicle has a tandem rear axle.

partsinfo.para: All vehicles in this recall need to have the service procedure completed. There is no inspection only option. Below you will find a VIN list that contains all the vehicles in this recall and the front wheel seal part number if needed. Please read ORDERING PARTS section below. TABLES 1 and 2 provide the hardware that may be needed, depending on what is found during the service procedure. We expect most VIN's will just need the torque procedure and not require new hardware.

ORDERING PARTS: Not all VIN's need the front axle serviced for this recall, but if they do, the front seal part number is provided in the attached VIN list at the end of this letter. Only one seal is needed since only the right side is involved. For all VIN's that need a front seal you must also order one hub gasket part number 3531210C1. Reference TABLES 1 and 2 if hardware is needed.

para.emph: RETURNING PARTS: DO NOT RETURN ANY PARTS.

table.title: Front Spider Hardware (No washers used on front)

entry.para: * NOTES: 9 of each piece are required for non-cast spiders or vehicles built with code 4092 and not with code 4774.
10 of each piece are required for cast spiders or vehicles with code 4091 or vehicles with codes 4092 and 4774.

Some vehicles may have 2-inch long bolts (PN: 25051R1) instead of the 1 and ¾ inch bolts. The two-inch length may not be necessary, verify the length that is needed by inspecting each bolt application.
Re-torque Brake Spider Mounting Rt. Side Front and Rear Axle (4x2)
Re-torque Brake Spider Mounting Rt. Side Front, Intermediate and Rear Axle (6x4)
Re-torque Brake Spider Mounting Rt. Side Rear Axle only (4x2). (Vehicle has Front Axle Code 02ARK or 02ARL)
Re-torque Brake Spider Mounting Rt. Side Rear and Intermediate Axles only (6x4). (Vehicle has Front Axle Code 02ARK or 02ARL)

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified IMMEDIATELY from your dealer location.
Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.
However, consistent with the customer notification, dealers are expected to complete the repairs on the mutually agreed upon service date.

To avoid having to replace a vehicle or refund the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.

claims.para: NOTE: All the vehicles in the recall must have the service procedure completed. There is not inspection only option. All claims must have CAUSE of 2 below.
Refer to Dealer Warranty Manual for procedures to conduct Recall Campaigns.

It is important that the Recall Coding be completed properly to assist in processing the warranty claim. Complete instructions will be found in the Warranty Manual, Section 7-1. Special attention should be given to Items 39 through 44:

responex.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your distributor location.
Export locations are to submit warranty claims in the usual manner making reference to this Recall number.
We ask for your full cooperation and follow-up to this important subject matter. If you have any questions or need further assistance, please contact your Regional Service Manager.
